questions.question: Actuator normal travel is controlled by:
On a twin engined DC aircraft having two DC generators load sharing is achieved by:
options: b. an equalizing circuit to sense the difference and equalize the voltages of the two generators
c. synchronizing relays and voltage coil tuners
d. an equalizing circuit to sense the difference and equalize the field currents of the two generators

questions.question: Pilots are informed of rotary actuator positions by:
options: b. lights or doll's eye indicators

questions.question: Press-to-test lights are used:
options: a. to indicate to the pilot that the circuit has power and is complete
b. to control the movement of a rotary actuator
c. to indicate to the pilot that the circuit has operated
d. only to indicate to the pilot that the equipment has malfunctioned

questions.question: A device for changing AC to DC is:
An inching control is used in conjunction with:
options: c. a combination of linear and rotary actuator

questions.question: Friction clutches are fitted to actuators for:
options: b. protection against brake on loads
c. protection against non-return valve failure
